parm_opt.c

00017 #include "stdio.h"
00018 #include "math.h"
00019 #include "utility.h"
00020 
00021 #define NEWTON_THRESHOLD 0.0001
00022 
00023 
00024 /*!*****************************************************************************
00025  *******************************************************************************
00026 \note  parm_opt
00027 \date  10/20/91
00028 
00029 \remarks 
00030                 this is the major optimzation program
00031 
00032  *******************************************************************************
00033  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00034 
00035  \param[in]     tol      : error tolernance to be achieved
00036  \param[in]     n_parm   : number of parameters to be optimzed
00037  \param[in]     n_con    : number of contraints to be taken into account
00038  \param[in]     f_dLda   : function which calculates the derivative of the 
00039                     optimziation criterion with respect to the parameters;
00040                     must return vector
00041  \param[in]     f_dMda   : function which calculates the derivate of the 
00042                     constraints with respect to parameters
00043                     must return matrix
00044  \param[in]     f_M      : constraints function, must always be formulted to
00045                     return 0 for properly fulfilled constraints
00046  \param[in]     f_L      : function to calculate simple cost (i.e., constraint
00047                     cost NOT included), the constraint costs are added
00048                     by this program automatically, the function returns
00049                     a double scalar
00050  \param[in]     f_dLdada : second derivative of L with respect to the parameters, 
00051                     must be a matrix of dim n_parm x n_parm
00052  \param[in]     f_dMdada : second derivative of M with respect to parameters,
00053                     must be a matrix n_con*n_parm x n_parm
00054  \param[in]     use_newton: TRUE or FALSE to indicate that second derivatives
00055                     are given and can be used for Newton algorithm
00056  \param[in,out] a        : initial setting of parameters and also return of
00057                     optimal value (must be a vector, even if scalar)
00058  \param[out]    final_cost: the final cost
00059  \param[out]    err       : the sqrt of the squared error of all constraints
00060                                 
00061       NOTE: - program returns TRUE if everything correct, otherwise FALSE
00062                         - always minimizes the cost!!!
00063                         -       algorithms come from Dyer McReynolds
00064                         
00065       NOTE: besides the possiblity of a bug, the Newton method seems to
00066                         sacrifice the validity of the constraint a little up to
00067                         quite a bit and should be used prudently
00068 
00069  ******************************************************************************/
00070 int
00071 parm_opt(double *a,int n_parm, int n_con, double *tol, void (*f_dLda)(), 
00072         void (*f_dMda)(), void (*f_M)(), double (*f_L)(), void (*f_dMdada)(),
00073         void (*f_dLdada)(), int use_newton, double *final_cost, double *err)
00074 
00075 {
00076   
00077   register int i,j,n;
00078   double cost= 999.e30;
00079   double last_cost = 0.0;
00080   double *mult=NULL, *new_mult=NULL; /* this is the vector of Lagrange mulitplier */
00081   double **dMda=NULL, **dMda_t=NULL;
00082   double *dLda;
00083   double *K=NULL; /* the error in the constraints */
00084   double eps = 0.025; /* the learning rate */
00085   double **aux_mat=NULL; /* needed for inversion of matrix */
00086   double *aux_vec=NULL;
00087   double *new_a;
00088   double **dMdada=NULL;
00089   double **dLdada=NULL;
00090   double **A=NULL; /* big matrix, a combination of several other matrices */
00091   double *B=NULL;  /* a big vector */
00092   double **A_inv=NULL;
00093   int    rc=TRUE;
00094   long   count = 0;
00095   int    last_sign = 1;
00096   int    pending1 = FALSE, pending2 = FALSE;
00097   int    firsttime = TRUE;
00098   int    newton_active = FALSE;
00099   
00100   dLda    = my_vector(1,n_parm);
00101   new_a   = my_vector(1,n_parm);
00102   if (n_con > 0) {
00103     mult    = my_vector(1,n_con);
00104     dMda    = my_matrix(1,n_con,1,n_parm);
00105     dMda_t  = my_matrix(1,n_parm,1,n_con);
00106     K       = my_vector(1,n_con);
00107     aux_mat = my_matrix(1,n_con,1,n_con);
00108     aux_vec = my_vector(1,n_con);
00109   }
00110 
00111   
00112   if (use_newton) {
00113     
00114     dLdada   = my_matrix(1,n_parm,1,n_parm);
00115     A        = my_matrix(1,n_parm+n_con,1,n_parm+n_con);
00116     A_inv    = my_matrix(1,n_parm+n_con,1,n_parm+n_con);
00117     B        = my_vector(1,n_parm+n_con);
00118 
00119     if (n_con > 0) {
00120       dMdada   = my_matrix(1,n_con*n_parm,1,n_parm);
00121       new_mult = my_vector(1,n_con);
00122     }
00123     
00124     for (i=1+n_parm; i<=n_con+n_parm; ++i) {
00125       for (j=1+n_parm; j<=n_con+n_parm; ++j) {
00126         A[i][j] = 0.0;
00127       }
00128     }
00129     
00130   }
00131   
00132   
00133   while (fabs(cost-last_cost) > *tol) {
00134     
00135     ++count;
00136     pending1 = FALSE;
00137     pending2 = FALSE;
00138     
00139   AGAIN:
00140     
00141     /* calculate the current Lagrange multipliers */
00142     
00143     if (n_con > 0) {
00144       (*f_M)(a,K);       /* takes the parameters, returns residuals */
00145       (*f_dMda)(a,dMda); /* takes the parameters, returns the Jacobian */
00146     }
00147     (*f_dLda)(a,dLda); /* takes the parameters, returns the gradient */
00148     
00149     if (n_con > 0) {
00150       mat_trans(dMda,dMda_t);
00151     }
00152     
00153     
00154     if (newton_active) {
00155       if (n_con > 0) {
00156         (*f_dMdada)(a,dMdada);
00157       }
00158       (*f_dLdada)(a,dLdada);
00159     }
00160     
00161     
00162     /* the first step is always a gradient step */
00163     
00164     if (newton_active) {
00165       
00166       if (firsttime) {
00167         firsttime = FALSE;
00168         eps = 0.1; 
00169       }
00170       
00171       
00172       /* build the A matrix */
00173       
00174       for (i=1; i<=n_parm; ++i) {
00175         for (j=1; j<=n_parm; ++j) {
00176           
00177           A[i][j] = dLdada[i][j];
00178           
00179           for (n=1; n<=n_con; ++n) {
00180             A[i][j] += mult[n]*dMdada[n+(i-1)*n_con][j];
00181           }
00182           
00183         }
00184       }
00185       
00186       
00187       for (i=1+n_parm; i<=n_con+n_parm; ++i) {
00188         for (j=1; j<=n_parm; ++j) {
00189           A[j][i] = A[i][j] = dMda[i-n_parm][j];
00190         }
00191       }
00192       
00193       
00194       /* build the B vector */
00195       
00196       if (n_con > 0) {
00197         mat_vec_mult(dMda_t,mult,B);
00198       }
00199       
00200       
00201       for (i=1; i<=n_con; ++i) {
00202         B[i+n_parm] = K[i];
00203       }
00204       
00205       /* invert the A matrix */
00206       
00207       if (!my_inv_ludcmp(A, n_con+n_parm, A_inv)) {
00208         rc = FALSE;
00209         break;
00210       }
00211       
00212       mat_vec_mult(A_inv,B,B);
00213       vec_mult_scalar(B,eps,B);
00214       
00215       for (i=1; i<=n_parm; ++i) {
00216         new_a[i] = a[i] + B[i];
00217       }
00218       
00219       for (i=1; i<=n_con; ++i) {
00220         new_mult[i] = mult[i] + B[n_parm+i];
00221       }
00222       
00223       
00224       
00225     } else {
00226       
00227       
00228       if (n_con > 0) {
00229 
00230         /* the mulitpliers are updated according:
00231            mult = (dMda dMda_t)^(-1) (K/esp - dMda dLda_t)       */
00232 
00233         mat_mult(dMda,dMda_t,aux_mat);
00234       
00235         if (!my_inv_ludcmp(aux_mat, n_con, aux_mat)) {
00236           rc = FALSE;
00237           break;
00238         }
00239       
00240         mat_vec_mult(dMda,dLda,aux_vec);
00241       
00242         vec_mult_scalar(K,1./eps,K);
00243       
00244         vec_sub(K,aux_vec,aux_vec);
00245       
00246         mat_vec_mult(aux_mat,aux_vec,mult);
00247 
00248       }
00249       
00250       
00251       /* the update step looks the following:
00252          a_new = a - eps * (dLda + mult_t * dMda)_t     */
00253       
00254       if (n_con > 0) {
00255 
00256         vec_mat_mult(mult,dMda,new_a);
00257       
00258         vec_add(dLda,new_a,new_a);
00259 
00260       } else {
00261 
00262         vec_equal(dLda,new_a);
00263 
00264       }
00265       
00266       vec_mult_scalar(new_a,eps,new_a);
00267       
00268       vec_sub(a,new_a,new_a);
00269       
00270     }
00271     
00272     
00273     if (count == 1 && !pending1) {
00274       
00275       last_cost  = (*f_L)(a);
00276 
00277       if (n_con > 0) {
00278         (*f_M)(a,K);
00279         last_cost += vec_mult_inner(K,mult);
00280       }
00281       
00282     } else {
00283     
00284       last_cost = cost;
00285 
00286     }
00287     
00288     /* calculate the updated cost */
00289     
00290     
00291     cost = (*f_L)(new_a);
00292     /*printf("   %f\n",cost);*/
00293 
00294     if (n_con > 0) {
00295 
00296       (*f_M)(new_a,K);
00297       
00298       if (newton_active) {
00299         cost += vec_mult_inner(K,new_mult);
00300       } else {
00301         cost += vec_mult_inner(K,mult);
00302       }
00303 
00304     }
00305     
00306     /* printf("last=%f new=%f\n",last_cost,cost); */
00307     
00308     
00309     /* check out whether we reduced the cost */
00310     
00311     if (cost > last_cost && fabs(cost-last_cost) > *tol) {
00312       
00313       /* reduce the gradient climbing rate: sometimes a reduction of eps
00314          causes an increase in cost, thus leave an option to increase
00315          eps */
00316       
00317       cost = last_cost; /* reset last_cost */
00318       
00319       
00320       if (pending1 && pending2) {
00321         
00322         /* this means that either increase nor decrease
00323            of eps helps, ==> leave the program */
00324         
00325         rc = TRUE;
00326         break;
00327         
00328       } else if (pending1) {
00329         
00330         eps *= 4.0;  /* the last cutting by half did not help, thus
00331                         multiply by 2 to get to previous value, and
00332                         one more time by 2 to get new value */
00333         pending2 = TRUE;
00334         
00335       } else {
00336         
00337         eps /= 2.0;
00338         pending1 = TRUE;
00339         
00340       }
00341       
00342       goto AGAIN;
00343       
00344     } else {
00345       
00346       vec_equal(new_a,a);
00347       if (newton_active && n_con > 0) {
00348         vec_equal(new_mult,mult);
00349       }
00350       if (use_newton && fabs(cost-last_cost) < NEWTON_THRESHOLD) 
00351         newton_active = TRUE;
00352       
00353     }
00354     
00355     
00356   }
00357   
00358   my_free_vector(dLda,1,n_parm);
00359   my_free_vector(new_a,1,n_parm);
00360   if (n_con > 0) {
00361     my_free_vector(mult,1,n_con);
00362     my_free_matrix(dMda,1,n_con,1,n_parm);
00363     my_free_matrix(dMda_t,1,n_parm,1,n_con);
00364     my_free_vector(K,1,n_con);
00365     my_free_matrix(aux_mat,1,n_con,1,n_con);
00366     my_free_vector(aux_vec,1,n_con);
00367   }
00368   
00369   if (use_newton) {
00370     
00371     my_free_matrix(dLdada,1,n_parm,1,n_parm);
00372     my_free_matrix(A,1,n_parm+n_con,1,n_parm+n_con);
00373     my_free_matrix(A_inv,1,n_parm+n_con,1,n_parm+n_con);
00374     my_free_vector(B,1,n_parm+n_con);
00375     if (n_con > 0) {
00376       my_free_matrix(dMdada,1,n_con*n_parm,1,n_parm);
00377       my_free_vector(new_mult,1,n_con);
00378     }
00379     
00380   }
00381   *final_cost = cost;
00382   *tol = fabs(cost-last_cost);
00383   if (n_con > 0) {
00384     *err = sqrt(vec_mult_inner(K,K));
00385   } else {
00386     *err = 0.0;
00387   }
00388 /*  
00389   printf("count=%ld  rc=%d\n",count,rc);
00390 */ 
00391   return rc;
00392   
00393 }
